oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |han=kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Different customs concerning the eating of the Porcupine. (L VII.-6. 6590 rev.-6594 rev.). Certain persons not allowed to eat the tail of the Porcupine (L VIII.-16. 7405-7409, 7408 rev. and 7409 rev.). A part of the Porcupine is used to prevent the evil consequences of eating !kui. (L VIII.-16. 7450 rev., note). Only old people and married women with their own huts can eat the tail safely. 1) |han=kass'o heard this story from his mother (|xabbi-an), 2) See also Method of cooking and eating porcupine, 3) This story is found in Book VIII-16.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A girl does not eat porcupines' tails
